Vocabularies.Definition: a. taking great care to avoid danger 谨慎的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The bank is very cautious about lending money.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. show (esp. a feeling or quality) 流露;显示;展示 n. an act of showing sth.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She displayed great self-control when they told her the news.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. go with 陪伴，陪同
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Let me accompany you to your hotel.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. display 展示 n. 展品
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The new cars were proudly exhibited in the showroom window.
e.g.  This painting is fairly typical of his early work.
e.g.  Stop acting like a baby! Pull yourself together!
e.g.  They purchased life at the expense of honor.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.，conj. however; in spite of that 然而; 虽然如此
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was angry; nevertheless, he listened to me.

Vocabularies.Definition: start to like 喜欢上 e.g.  Did the children take to their new teacher?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Did the children take to their new teacher?

Vocabularies.Definition: a. extremely impressive and attractive; excellent 宏大的，壮观的;出色的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The royal wedding was a magnificent occasion.

Vocabularies.Definition: make (sth.) clear and easy to understand 阐明 e.g.  Does this information shed any light on the problem?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Does this information shed any light on the problem?
e.g.  He indicated his willingness with a nod of his head.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. see and notice; watch carefully 观察;注意 e.g.  Did you observe anything unusual in his behavior?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Did you observe anything unusual in his behavior?

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make (sb.) feel suddenly frightened or worried 使惊慌，使恐慌 n. 惊慌，恐慌;警报
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The government is alarmed by the dramatic increase in violent crime.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. refuse to accept 拒绝接受
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was rejected for the army because of his bad eyesight.
